title: Tuesday Everton News : Fofana & Montiel links , DCL pursuit by Newcastle , Textor evaluated
body_text:
Tuesday’s Everton News: Fofana & Montiel links, DCL pursuit by Newcastle, Textor evaluated
Recapping all the Everton news from yesterday.
Your daily dose of Everton news and rumours
Everton are currently locked in talks with Ligue 1 club Marseille over a deal for 28-year-old forward Neal Maupay. [Foot Mercato]
Our RBM match preview as Everton take on Doncaster Rovers in the Carabao Cup. [RBM]
Everton are in discussions with Chelsea over the loan signing of striker David Datro Fofana. [TEAMtalk]
Sevilla defender and Argentina World Cup winning fullback Gonzalo Montiel appears a step closer to joining Everton as he missed first-team training on Monday, though Borussia Dortmund and Nottingham Forest are also in the running.
It is expected that it will take a bid of £9m to pry Montiel away from Sevilla. [TEAMtalk]
How long can Sean Dyche continue to use a lack of Premier League experience to delay the integration of the club’s summer signings into a first XI in need of a boost after two chastening defeats? [ Echo]
Everton are set to miss out on Arsenal’s Eddie Nketiah despite the collapse of his Nottingham Forest move as Arsenal are still prioritising a sale. [Football Insider]
Newcastle United could leave Everton with a battle to keep their talisman during the final days of the transfer window as Eddie Howe is desperately looking to tempt Dominic Calvert-Lewin to St James’ Park. [givemesport]
Paul Quinn delves deep into the John Textor takeover and the future does not seem so bright. [The Esk]
The 19 runs made by Dominic Calvert-Lewin challenging the Brighton backline on the opening weekend remain the most by any Premier League player this season. There were 17 more of them in the 4-0 defeat to Tottenham. He tops the list for attacking runs. [Sky Sports]
Alan Shearer has claimed Everton are now in desperate need of their takeover situation being resolved:
“Already, the manager’s saying: ‘we’ve got a small squad to choose from’. I know they’ve got one or two injuries, but he’s going to have to use all of his experience wisely this season, if he’s going to keep Everton in the Premier League.
And the sooner they get taken over in terms of being bought by someone who’s invested. Who wants to be there long term, who’s interested, and all of that, the better it will be for them. The longer it goes on, the more I fear for them.” [The Rest is Football Podcast]
An overview of the transfer situation at Goodison Park as we head into the last week of the transfer window. [Echo]
John Textor is preparing to launch within days a plan to take his sports and technology holding company public at a valuation of over $2bn. [Sky News]
Neal Maupay has hit out at Everton fans that abused him and his teammates.
What to Watch
Everton play Doncaster Rovers in a slew of third round matches in the Carabao Cup. UEFA Champions League and Europa Conference League qualifying continues.
